channel.title: Create and track feature requests for Atlassian products.
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70876] Notifications not being sent when an issue is created by email with inline image and thumbnail disabled
item.description:
Summary

The "Issue Created" notification is not being delivered listeners of the event when a Service Desk issue is created via email with an inline image.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Access the attachments settings and then Disable Thumbnails
  2. Set the notification scheme to notify users from Role Service Desk Team for issue created event.
  3. Send an email to JSD mail handler with an inline image.

Expected Results

  • Jira should process the message and then notify the users.

Actual Results

The message is processed, but the notification is not being sent. The below exception is thrown:

msg:	 Error while processing message: MailingListCompiler#sendItem	
    	 stack:	 com.atlassian.mail.MailException: Error while processing message: MailingListCompiler#sendItem
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:137)
message:	 Failed to send issue notification emails

Notes

  • If you attach the image no issue occurs.
  • It only happens if the image is embedded inline.
  • Customer notifications are not affected by the bug

Workaround

  • Enable the thumbnails or send the image attached instead.
item.summary: Notifications not being sent when an issue is created by email with inline image and thumbnail disabled

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70787] Android Mobile App users cannot see issues in a state with jira.permission.create.clone.denied
item.description:
Summary

Unable to visualize issues, with the issue has the property jira.permission.create.clone.denied on the status.

Steps to replicate

Create project with the property jira.permission.create.clone.denied
Create issue
Transition issue to the status with the property

Expected Result

Able to visualize the issue

Actual Result

Unable to visualize the issue.

Workaround

Remove the property will make the issue appear. After that, you can add the property back, that the issue will continue to show up.
item.summary: Android Mobile App users cannot see issues in a state with jira.permission.create.clone.denied

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70785] Can't remove Jira space link
item.description:
Summary

It is not possible to remove a space link from Jira. This happens even after the integration has been removed from Confluence end.

How to reproduce

  1. Go to Jira project
  2. From the left navigation menu select pages
  3. Link a space to the page
  4. Now try to remove the space from page (No UI element to remove the page)
  5. Go to the space settings on Confluence
  6. Click the Tab "integrations" ==>Click the tab "application links"
  7. Select Jira integration and delete the space

Expected behavior

The space should now be disconnected on Jira

Actual results

The space is still accessible from Jira

Workaround

Currently none
item.summary: Can't remove Jira space link

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70781] XSS in labels widget
item.description:
If a user can control the content returned by

/rest/dashboards/1.0/<dashboard_id>/gadget/10100/prefs

they can update the searchUrl field to execute a stored XSS.

Here are the steps to reproduce:

  1. Upload an attachment to a ticket with the following content: 
    {"groups":[{"key":"A-Z","labels":[{"label":"XSS","searchUrl":"javascript:alert(0);"}]}],"field":"Labels","project":"53W5"}
  2. Fetch the attachment ID from Jira (e.g. via /rest/api/2/issue/<issue_id>)
  3. Create a new label widget on a Dashboard and save it with the following content: 
    {"up_isConfigured":true,"up_projectid":"../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../secure/attachment/<attachment_id>","up_fieldId":"foobar"}
    1. This can be done by issuing a PUT request to /rest/dashboards/1.0/<dashboard_id>/gadget/<gadget_id>/prefs
  4. Load the Dashboard and click on the XSS

I think there are two issues at play here:

  1. The user has control over the full path for fetching the gadget content (this is in https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRACLOUD/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/static/dashboarditem/labels/Labels.js#69)
    1. Remediation: Apply a regex that only allows valid project IDs (whitelist)
  2. The content of the response for the gadget content is trusted and inserted into the page verbatim: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRACLOUD/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/static/dashboarditem/labels/Labels.soy#29
    1. Remediation: Apply URI scheme whitelisting as recommended on https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SECURITY/pages/158006558/URI+scheme+whitelisting. Better yet, if you know which URI schemes you can expect (only HTTP/HTTPS maybe?) you can restrict this list even further.

Note: Selected a random version since I couldn't determine mine.
item.summary: XSS in labels widget

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

comments.comment:
CVSS v3 score: 5.4 => Medium severity

Exploitability Metrics

Attack Vector Network
Attack Complexity Low
Privileges Required Low
User Interaction Required

Scope Metric

Scope Changed

Impact Metrics

Confidentiality Low
Integrity Low
Availability None

See http://go.atlassian.com/cvss for more details.

https://asecurityteam.bitbucket.io/cvss_v3/#CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70759] Can't create any projects after deleting all projects in the instance
item.description:
Summary

When deleting all the projects in the instance, the Create Project button does not work.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a new instance
  2. Create a project
  3. Delete the project
  4. Click on Projects on the left panel, the Create project button does not work anymore, preventing users from creating any projects.

Expected Results

  • User should be able to create a project.

Actual Results

  • The button is not responsive.

Workaround

  • Use REST API to create the project. As long as there is a project in the instance, the Create project button will work.
  • Refer to the REST API Documentation
item.summary: Can't create any projects after deleting all projects in the instance

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70756] Issue split view Icons appear over the calendar
item.description:
Summary

When updating date picker in issue split view, the issue icons appear over the calendar

Looks fine right before the calendar hits the top

Watch what happens when the calendar hits the top

How to reproduce

  1. Click on the Backlog.
  2. Click on an issue
  3. In the split view of the issue update the due date
  4. When calendar pops open, scroll down

Expected behavior

The calendar should be hidden by the scroll view

Actual results

The calendar appears ove the scroll view

Workaround

Currently none
item.summary: Issue split view Icons appear over the calendar

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70755] Scroll bar on the select list (single choice) field disappear when there's too many options
item.description:
Summary

If there are too many options on the select list field, the scrollbar is not working as expected. Clicking on it would cause the scrollbar to disappear.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a select list custom field with at least 9 options
  2. Assign it to a screen
  3. Go to the board
  4. Click on any issue
  5. Click on the custom field
  6. Click on the scrollbar

Expected Results

Able to scroll

Actual Results

Scrollbar disappear

Workaround

Open the issue in the new tab OR use the old JIRA view
item.summary: Scroll bar on the select list (single choice) field disappear when there's too many options

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70751] Jira returns 400 error when searching for double-byte chars in quick search in IE
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce

  1. Open Confluence Cloud in IE11
  2. Click the search icon from the sidebar
  3. Enter "テスト" and press return

Expected Results

The search result will be displayed

Actual Results

Following error will be shown

Workaround

  • Use the search screen(Jira -> Issues and filters -> Search issues)
  • Use a different browser
item.summary: Jira returns 400 error when searching for double-byte chars in quick search in IE

status.description: Atlassian needs to verify that this issue exists

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70747] On a iOS device,moving the issue type for a JSD project issue is not changing the status
item.description:
Summary

On an iOS device, when the issue type of a JSD project issue is changed, the issue type changes correctly but the status of the issue does not change. This puts the issue in a very weird state as the current status of the issue is not part of the workflow of the new issue type.

Environment

iOS
Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  • From the Jira app on iOS login and access the JSD project.
  • Change the issue type for an issue in the JSD project.
  • The issue type will change successfully but the issue status will not change.
  • The same can be confirmed by logging into the instance from the browser.
  • Basically, the issue status will not match the issue type workflow.

Expected Results

The change in the issue type of a JSD issue from an iOS device should also change the issue status(or at least an option to select the right status)

Actual Results

The change in the issue type of a JSD issue from an iOS device is not changing its status.

Workaround

None
item.summary: On a iOS device,moving the issue type for a JSD project issue is not changing the status

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70746] Notification scheme shows an error 500 when you add a JSD portal-only user as recipient
item.description:
Summary

When you're editing a notification scheme, JIRA allows you to select Service Desk portal-only users in the single user picker, and when you try to save, an error 500 is presented.

Environment

  • JIRA Cloud Service Desk

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the project settings > Notifications
  2. Click on Actions > Edit Notifications
  3. Click on Add (any event type)
  4. In the single-user field, start typing a name that matches a JSD portal-only user username
  5. Try to add the new notification with the portal-only user selected

Expected Results

An error should be presented stating that portal-only users cannot receive JIRA notifications. Or, they should not even be presented in this user-picker field.

Actual Results

An error 500 message is presented. This gives the idea that something is wrong in JIRA when in fact this could not be possible to be made by the customer.
item.summary: Notification scheme shows an error 500 when you add a JSD portal-only user as recipient

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70744] Incorrect URL when clicking on Cancel within notification scheme association
item.description:
Summary

When you're in the Notification Scheme association page, from within a project, and click on Cancel, the URL is incorrect and missing the project key. An error is presented stating that the project 'notifications' does not exist.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the project settings > Notifications
  2. Click on Actions > Use a different scheme
  3. Click on Cancel

Expected Results

The system redirects you to the notification scheme page

Actual Results

The project key is missing from the URL that the Cancel link redirects, so an error is presented because the system redirects you to an invalid page.

Workaround

Manually go back to the notification scheme page by using the browser navigation.
item.summary: Incorrect URL when clicking on Cancel within notification scheme association

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70705] Issue creation fails with 500 error after uninstalling an add-on
item.description:
Summary

After uninstalling a third party add-on the issue creation in Jira may fail with 500 error.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Install BigPIcture
  2. Set the create screen configuration of a project to use the Risk XXX custom fields from BigPicture.
  3. Unsubscribe and then uninstall the BigPicture add-on
  4. Create an issue on the project.

Expected Results

The issue should be created.

Actual Results

The issue creation fails with a 500 error.

<p>Referer URL: <b>https://try-ramon-zephyr.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssue.jspa</b></p><pre>java.lang.NullPointerException</pre><blockquote id="stacktrace" style="overflow-x: auto;"><pre>java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.validateCreateIssueFields(IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.validateCreateIssueFields(IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.validateAndCreateIssueFromFields(DefaultIssueService.java:810)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.lambda$validateCreate$10(DefaultIssueService.java:758)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.metrics.Timer.time(Timer.java:171)

Workaround

After awhile the issue resolves itself and the issue can be created.
item.summary: Issue creation fails with 500 error after uninstalling an add-on

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70702] opsbar-sequence property does not work in new issue view
item.description:
Summary

opsbar-sequence property doesn't sequence transitions in corrent order in new issue view.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create multiple transitions from a status to other status'.
  2. Add opsbar-sequence property to each of the transtions and provide value based on how you want to order it.
  3. Checking in old issue view - the transitions are ordered as they are set in properties. On the contrary, the transitions do not follow the order as set in properties for the transitions.

Expected Results

Transitions should be in proper sequence as set in workflow properties in the new issue view.

Actual Results

Transtions do not appear in proper sequence. It does not follow the sequence as it is mentioned in opsbar-seqeunce property.

Workaround

No Workaround.
item.summary: opsbar-sequence property does not work in new issue view

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70697] New issue view for Jira Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails
item.description:
Summary

New issue view for Jira Software Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Turn off the new issue view in your personal settings
  2. Find a Jira Software issue with an existing image attachment
  3. Comment to that Jira issue with a content of 
     {quote} !filename.png|thumbnail! {quote}
  1. Confirm image appears in the comment as a quoted message
  2. return to your personal settings/profile and re-enable the new issue view
  3. refresh the Jira issue

Expected Results

Comment shows up as expected, with quoted text that contains an image/thumbnail

Actual Results

Comment does not show any content at all, including missing unquoted text.
When looking that the browser console you can see an error of:

RangeError: Invalid content for node blockquote
    at K.createChecked (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-fabric-renderer.9ee52142d83cf36e3350.7.js:1)
    at t.b (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at e.parse (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at Object.encode (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-fabric-renderer.9ee52142d83cf36e3350.7.js:1)
    at t.a (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at t.n.getAdfFromHtml (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at t.value (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at Pn (vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1)
    at qn (vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1)
    at us (vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1)
Jn @ vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1

Notes

Only appears to affect Jira Software projects, this does not appear to happen for Jira Core projects.

 

Workaround

Disabling the new issue view in your Personal settings can prevent this display problem for the time being.
item.summary: New issue view for Jira Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70696] Change option to Log Time in the New Issue View
item.description:
Summary

In the New Issue view, when one wants to adjust the Start date and time, the only time interval available is between 9am and 6pm

Environment

  • Jira Software Cloud
  • New Issue View

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Access any issue in the new issue view.
  2. Attempt to log time.
  3. Attempt to edit the Date started by clicking the calendar sign next to it
    Notice the time picker only shows the 9am - 6pm time interval
  1. Expected Results
    The time picker should show a whole day time interval

Actual Results

The time picker only shows 9am - 6pm, in 30 minutes increments

Workaround

There are currently 2 workarounds:

  1. Disable New Jira issue view under Profile → Labs section. This will bring the old issue view with another date/time picker
item.summary: Change option to Log Time in the New Issue View

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70692] When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list and sub-bullets then changing the style of the text, it starts a new line
item.description:
Summary

When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list and sub-bullets then changing the style of the text (including Hyperlinks), it starts a new line.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Enable the new issue view
  2. Open a ticket and add a bullet list with many sub-bullet points on the description.

Expected Results

It would look like this:

Actual Results

On the new issue view, after saving the description, it shows like this:

Workaround

Use the old view.
item.summary: When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list and sub-bullets then changing the style of the text, it starts a new line

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70690] Sprint burndown and Sprint health gadget not working properly in IE11
item.description:
Summary

The sprint burndown gadget gadget won't load in the dashboard. It won't be possible to edit it either (when clicking on the ellipses button, the edit option will not be displayed).
When click to view as wallboard, the gadget will be displayed as blank:

The sprint health gadget does work properly in the dashboard view, but when viewing in wallboard, it will behave the same way as the burndown gadget:

In both cases (including the dashboard view), the same error is triggered in the browser console:

Environment

Jira Cloud (IE11).

Steps to Reproduce

  1. In your dashboard, click on Add gadget -> select the sprint burndown gadget;
  2. Do the same as the previous step, but select the sprint health gadget;
  3. Notice in the dashboard view that the sprint burndown gadget will not load;
  4. Click on the ellipses button (dashboard) -> View as wallboard;
  5. Both the sprint health gadget and the burndown gadget will be displayed as blank squares;
  6. Other gadgets will work though.

Expected Results

Both gadgets would load their content in both the dashboard view and the wallboard view.

Actual Results

The Sprint burndown gadget won't work in neither the dashboard view, nor in the wallboard view.
The Sprint health gadget won't work in the wallboard view.

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: Sprint burndown and Sprint health gadget not working properly in IE11

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70684] Invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project, the returned links are in api version 2
item.description:
Summary

When creating integrations for Jira and using 3LO for apps, invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project returns links that are still in version 2, and when they are accessed, that results in an HTTP 403 - Forbidden. Invoking invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/2/project results in a 403 as well

Steps to replicate

  1. Go through this until you get to: https://api.atlassian.com/oauth/token/accessible-resources
  2. Make a call to https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project and replace cloud-id
  3. Notice that links are in version 2:
  4. Try to invoke https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/2/project and returned 403
item.summary: Invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project, the returned links are in api version 2

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

comments.comment:
Hello Guys, 

I saw that you have passed this issue to medium severity.

We are blocked right now by this issue. 

Is there any workaround/suggestions on this?

Many thanks

Hi Karam EL HABOUTI,
Current workaround is to create those urls manually based on data/ids from the response.

The issue is on our radar however I cannot commit to any date.

Hi,

Thank you for your prompt response.

The API v3 is not complete, requesting other endpoints like /issue returns an empty payload.

I think that v3 is in beta, right?

Thanks

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70683] Attachment shown as Unable to render if contain exclamation point
item.description:
How to reproduce:

  • Create an attachment with exclamation point as the attached example.
  • Add the attachment as comment

Expected:

  • The attachment are shown correctly

Actual:

  • The attachment is shown as Unable to render
item.summary: Attachment shown as Unable to render if contain exclamation point

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70678] "KB Hub", "Customer Channels", "Invite Team" buttons code bugged when administering a SD project
item.description:
Summary

In the updated navigation left sidebar, when a Jira admin is administering a Service Desk project, the "KB Hub", "Customer Channels" and "Invite Team" buttons are bugged, showing the code of the button instead of the button itself. Also, the button doesn't work.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Pre req 1: Be sure your instance is using the updated navigation left sidebar;
  2. Pre req 2: Be a Jira admin of that instance;
  3. Type the g key twice on your keyboard (gg) or, as alternative, your period key ( . ), then Projects;
  4. Find a Service Desk project, click the . . . icon on your right corner, then Project settings;
  5. Click Back to project.

Expected Results

  • All of the buttons of the left sidebar, used to administer the project, are available and functional

Actual Results

  • The "KB Hub", "Customer Channels" and "Invite Team" buttons are bugged, showing the code of the button instead of the button itself. Also, the button doesn't work.

Workaround(s)

  1. Open a support ticket at support.atlassian.com.
item.summary: "KB Hub", "Customer Channels", "Invite Team" buttons code bugged when administering a SD project

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70676] Scrolling while typing in the Assignee and in the Reporter field will hide their results
item.description:
Summary

If you scroll the screen while typing in the Assignee or in the reporter field (edit, create screen) their results will be lost, and you will need to restart typing it to retrieve them again.

See in this recording on how they differ from custom user picker fields: Assignee_Reporter - behaviour.mp4

Environment

Jira Cloud.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Click to edit an issue;
  2. Start typing in the Assignee or in the reporter field;
  3. While the results are being displayed, scroll the page.

Expected Results

The results will keep being displayed.

Actual Results

The results are lost and you need to delete what you've typed and start typing again to retrieve the results.

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: Scrolling while typing in the Assignee and in the Reporter field will hide their results

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70576] Find new add-ons page doesn't load if hungary/magyar language selected
item.description:
Summary

Find new add-ons page doesn't load if Hungary/Magyar language selected in User Profile Settings.

Steps to reproduce

  • Navigate to: https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
  • Change the language to Magya (Magyarorszag)
  • Go to Find new add-ons page: https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/featured?source=side_nav_find_new_addons

Actual Results

  • The page is not fully rendered; making it impossible to add new add-ons

Expected Results

The page is fully rendered and loaded.

Workaround

Change the language to English.
item.summary: Find new add-ons page doesn't load if hungary/magyar language selected

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70574] For instances with Jira Core only, some issue types are missing from Default Issue Type Scheme
item.description:
Summary

In "Default Issue Type Scheme", some issue types are missing and admin cannot add/remove the issue types

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to Jira Settings > Issues > Issue type schemes
  2. Edit Default Issue Type Scheme

Expected Results

  • It should show all issue types in the scheme
  • It should allow to add/remove the issue types

Actual Results

  • Only "Epic" is in the list
  • Unable to add/remove the issue types
item.summary: For instances with Jira Core only, some issue types are missing from Default Issue Type Scheme

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

comments.comment:
Hello Chiou,

Thanks for the confirmation of this bug we are looking forward for the fix let us know any workaround at moment.

Regards,
Arjun

attachment.name: Core but with epic and bug.png
attachment.author: rgebhardt@atlassian.com

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70571] Comments from mobile that are restricted show padlocks in place of the comment in Russian in Old Issue View
item.description:
Summary

If you create comments from the mobile app, then restrict them, When using the new issue view in the Russian language, you will see the comments replaced by a number of restriction locks.

Environment

Cloud (Old Issue View)

Steps to Reproduce

  1. create a comment in an issue using the mobile platform
  2. Edit the issue so that you can restrict the comment to a specific group
  3. change to Russian language and view the issue
  4. Change to the old issue view if needed

Expected Results

The Comment is displayed as expected

Actual Results


As you can see, the comment is replaced by grey locks.

Workaround

This issue only appears if all of the following factors are met:

  • The comment was created from the mobile app
  • The comment is restricted
  • You are viewing the issue in the Old issue view
  • You are viewing the issue in Russian

If you can prevent or change any of those factors, you will not see this issue.
item.summary: Comments from mobile that are restricted show padlocks in place of the comment in Russian in Old Issue View

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70570] Gadgets' background colour on "Wallboard" view of the dashboard is no longer black
item.description:
Summary

The gadgets' background colour on "Wallboard" view of dashboards used to be black. It is now white.

Environment

  • New Jira UI

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to a dashboard
  2. Add a gadget or 2
  3. View dashboard as wallboard

Expected Results

Actual Results

Workaround

Non
item.summary: Gadgets' background colour on "Wallboard" view of the dashboard is no longer black

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70567] startofweek() jql function doesn't reflect system locale
item.description:
According to Advanced searching - functions reference:

For the startOfWeek() function the result depends upon your locale. For example, in Europe the first day
of the week is generally considered to be Monday, while in the USA it is considered to be Sunday.

But, seem not the case where only able to search start on Sunday issue.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

  1. Create issues in a project on Sunday and on Monday
  2. Change the time zone in the personal profile to Europe and GMT+1 or GMT+2.
  3. Change the Default users' time zone in the Jira Settings > Systems > General Configuration.
  4. In the Look and feel section, enable Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker in the Date/time formats.
  5. Look for issues created after startOfWeek().
  6. The issues that were created on Sunday and Monday will be displayed and not just after Monday.

Please investigate on what factor determines the Locale of the instance, as modifying the time zones in the Personal Profile and the General configuration does not bring about any changes in the search results.
item.summary: startofweek() jql function doesn't reflect system locale

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70559] Create issue through REST API failed with error
item.description:
Summary

Sending a REST API to create issue will fail when the value of description exceeds 10323 characters.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Prepare a Json file that contains value for description more than 10323 characters
  2. Run CURL command: 
    • curl --request POST --url 'https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue' --user email:token  --header 'Accept: application/json'  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data @descriptionValue.json

Actual Results

Error message will be shown.

{"errorMessages":["We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file."],"errors":{}}

Expected Results

Issue is created.

Notes

It is possible to insert characters up to 32767 to description field when users create the issue from the UI.
item.summary: Create issue through REST API failed with error

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70558] Unable to preview images that are uploaded using Jira mobile app
item.description:
Summary

When you click on an image attachment that is added to an issue using iOS application, the image won't be previewed and will be downloaded directly. While if the same image is uploaded through web interface it will be previewed when you click on it.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Access an issue using JIRA iOS application
  2. Upload an image to the issue.
  3. Access the issue using a browser (in PC) and click on the uploaded attachment

Expected Results

The image attachment is being previewed

Actual Results

The image will be downloaded directly

Notes

  • Tested for images with JPG and PNG extensions.
  • The image attachments could be previewed when accessing through iOS app or mobile browser.
item.summary: Unable to preview images that are uploaded using Jira mobile app

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70556] Searching for STATUS CHANGED BY is suggesting status names instead of usernames
item.description:
Summary

When searching for "STATUS CHANGED BY", instead of suggesting usernames, it's suggeting status names.

Steps to Reproduce

To reproduce:

  1. Go to the advanced search page.
  2. type "status changed by" and then a space.

Expected: suggestions from a list of users that changes as you type.

Actual: suggestions show the Status field values.

Workaround

If you happen to know the full username/email/exact spelling and can type it, the search work
item.summary: Searching for STATUS CHANGED BY is suggesting status names instead of usernames

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70552] Create linked issue does not respect custom field config context default values
item.description:
Summary

Create linked issue does not respect custom field config scheme context

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a select list custom field
  2. Create a new context so there are 2 and assign each context to a project and provide different values/option
  3. Set default value for each context
  4. Mark field as required in field config for both projects
  5. Note when creating an issue in each project now they have different values and a set default value according to the context
  6. Create a linked issue
  7. Note the default values are not respected, it chooses the first valuy as opposed to the default or none

Expected Results

The default option defined in the field context should be chosen

Actual Results

The first option is selected regardless of the chosen default

Notes

Also effects radio buttons, sometimes an incorrect value is chosen, other times no value is chosen

Workaround

No known workaround
item.summary: Create linked issue does not respect custom field config context default values

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

comments.comment:
Thanks for having opening an issue for this bug.

I hope it will be soon corrected, because it can lead to error when filling form during the creation of the linked issue. As a wrong preselected option is proposed, if the agent is not careful the field in the created linked issue will have not the intended value (it will have the first choice instead the default one).

And in our case we use this for important billing information to transfert issue information from service desk issue to the Jira software issue, so even if the bug himself is low priority, it can lead business problem.

Best regards.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70551] Field applicable context menu summary does not display selected issue types
item.description:
Summary

Field applicable context menu summary does not display selected issue types

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Edit a fields applicable context and select a specific issue type
  2. Save
  3. Notice on the field context summary the chosebn issue type is not displayed

Expected Results

The selected issue types for that congtext are displayed like the project is

Actual Results

The issue types field remaains empty on screen which means the user must then click on the conterxt condfiguration to see which issue types the context applies to

Notes

Workaround

No known workaround
item.summary: Field applicable context menu summary does not display selected issue types

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70550] Jira Mobile-Can't create Subtask if a required field is present
item.description:
Summary

Creating a subtask which has a required field fails to save.

Environment

  • This can be reproduced on both Jira Android and iOS applications

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Add a required field to a Sub-task screen
  2. Try creating Sub-task from the Mobile Application

Expected Results

The subtask gets created.

Actual Results

"Failed to save" error is returned.
item.summary: Jira Mobile-Can't create Subtask if a required field is present

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70548] Table isn't rendering on JIRA mobile apps
item.description:
Problem Statement

JIRA Mobile isn't rendering table from JIRA issues

Steps to Replicate

  1. Include table on Summary/Comments on a JIRA issue
  2. View from JIRA mobile app

Expected Result

Table visible on the JIRA mobile App

Actual Result
item.summary: Table isn't rendering on JIRA mobile apps

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.
